Bash(come up with a way to pull in a food library".

**Food Search System:**
- Created /api/nutrition/foods with 34 common foods
- Searchable modal matching peptide library pattern
- Click food â†’ Auto-fills form â†’ Quick add
- Categories: Protein, Carbs, Fats, Vegetables, Restaurant

**Simplified Food Entry:**
- Only Name and Calories required (macros optional)
- Clear "Optional" placeholders on P/C/F fields
- Search button prominently placed at top
- Manual entry still available below

**Food Database Includes:**
- 10 Protein sources (chicken, beef, salmon, eggs, etc)
- 10 Carb sources (rice, potatoes, oats, pasta, etc)
- 6 Fat sources (avocado, nuts, oils, etc)
- 4 Vegetables
- 4 Restaurant meals (Chipotle, Chick-fil-A, etc)

**User Flow:**
1. Click "Add Food"
2. Click "Search Food Database" 
3. Type "chicken" or browse
4. Click food â†’ Form pre-fills
5. Adjust meal type â†’ Log

This matches the peptide tracker experience exactly. No more 
typing macros manually for common foods!
